response.overview: During an assignment, foreign correspondent Steve Martin spends a layover in Tokyo and is caught amid the rampage of an unstoppable prehistoric monster the Japanese call 'Godzilla'. The only hope for both Japan and the world lies on a secret weapon, which may prove more destructive than the monster itself.
response.title: Godzilla, King of the Monsters!

release_dates.note: Les Films du Verseau release titled "Godzilla". 92-minutes, re-adds Japanese footage that was cut from the US version. Dubbing by Studios "S.I.M.".
Exact date unknown.
Obras-Primas do Cinema Blu-ray Digipack set. Portuguese subtitles. Packaged with "Godzilla" (1954) and "Godzilla Raids Again" (1955) (two discs).
Les Films du Verseau release titled "Godzilla". 92-minutes, re-adds Japanese footage that was cut from the US version. Dubbing by Studios "S.I.M.".
Eros Films release
The Criterion Collection/Sony Blu-ray set titled "Godzilla, the Showa-Era Films, 1954-1975".
Paramount Pictures/Documento Film release titled "Godzilla".  Dubbing by Fonolux. Exact date unknown.

Luigi Cozzi/Paramount/Documento Film release titled "Godzilla" (widely referred to as "Cozzilla"). 96-minutes, re-edited with new footage and colorized via a process called "Spectrorama 70". Uses Fonolux dub from 1957. Date unknown.
Toho Co., Ltd. release titled "Monster King Godzilla". In English with Japanese subtitles. Cropped from 1:37:1 to 2:35:1. Uses Original NYC "GODZILLA" title card.

TOHO Visual Entertainment 4K UHD + Blu-ray. Uses the last known, tattered and incomplete print of "Monster King Godzilla" (1957) for its presentation, only in standard HD. Packaged with "Godzilla" (1954) (same disc).
Loew's State Theatre, New York City, New York. Uses original title/title card, "GODZILLA".
Beginning of expansion to other theaters across the US.
Goodtimes Entertainment DVD. 1.33:1 aspect ratio.
The Criterion Collection DVD / Blu-ray Digipack. First new restoration of the US version since the 1983 Vestron Video VHS. Packaged with "Godzilla" (1954) (two disc DVD) (one disc BD).
Classic Media Collector's Edition DVD Digipack. Packaged with "Godzilla" (1954) (two discs). Same presentation for US version as the 2002 release. Includes 12-page booklet.
Simitar Entertainment DVD. 2-sided disc with original 1.37:1 aspect ratio on one side, and a cropped 1.66:1 presentation on the opposite side.
The Criterion Collection 4K UHD + Blu-ray. US version is in standard HD only. Packaged with "Godzilla" (1954).

Simitar Entertainment DVD set titled "Godzilla: 5 Rampaging Movies". Packaged w/"Godzilla versus The Thing", "Godzilla versus Monster Zero", "Godzilla's Revenge", and "Terror of Mechagodzilla". 5 discs, same features as 1998 disc.
Classic Media/Sony Music Entertainment/Sony Wonder DVD. 1.33:1 aspect ratio. Same video master as Simitar's release.
The Criterion Collection Blu-ray set titled "Godzilla, the Showa-Era Films, 1954-1975". Same as 2012 release but with updated menus. Packaged with "Godzilla" (1954) (same disc, disc 1/8).
Classic Media DVD. Reissue of the 2006 set with the same features, but in a standard DVD keep case and excluding the booklet.
